Text: Can this be installed alongside with normal XP?That way that I can choose, which one to boot from?

YES.

You'll need to create a new Logical partition first using Partition Magic or Acronis Disk Director.  Once you've created a new partition.

Boot from the XP_JACKED CD and specify that you want the installation on the new partition you just created,

After JACKED installs, when your computer first starts up (Pre-Windows) you'll be prompted to choose which OS to boot into.  (The most recently installed OS is on top--JACKED).  

Good luck

How exactly do I install this?
Thanks, have to try this.I dont have high end PC, but I need more power to music progs.

Installation Instructions:

1. Unzip the .7z file
2. An ISO file will pop out, butn this file to a CDR using Nero or your favorite burning utility,
3. Place the CD in your drive.
4. Restart your computer
5. When prompted, Boot from CD (you may need to change your BIOS information so your CD drive boots before your HD).
7.  Choose a partition to format and install Windows XP JACKED
8.  Read a magazine, the installation is unattended so it doesn't need any input from you.  It will be finished before you finish your magazine.

Grateful 'tho I am for all your hard work, reatta32, (this program might just help get back my life's work on dead PC) - one word of contructive criticism, if I may.

This ISO comes out as 469,112 KB.  But the most I can burn onto a CD (as an ISO) is about 450,000 KB.  Is that just me - or is it common??  If it is common, would it be worthwhile trimming the size of this version just ever so slightly?

If it is just me - and I should be able to write bigger ISOs to CD - then apologies - and I'll try to see how to write bigger ISOs ... tho' I don't know yet!
